alert.note: Alert for Mono (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 14 at 1:41PM PST until December 16 at 1:00PM PST by NWS Reno
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 7 PM WEDNESDAY TO 1 PM PST THURSDAY... ...WINTER STORM WARNING FOR TODAY IS CANCELLED... * WHAT...Periods of moderate to heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 5 inches along Highway 395, 6 to 12 inches west of Highway 395 including Mammoth Lakes, and up to 1 inch in the Chalfant Valley. Winds gusting 30 to 40 mph, with Sierra ridges gusting to 80 mph. * WHERE...Mono County. * WHEN...From 7 PM Wednesday to 1 PM PST Thursday. Heaviest snowfall rates 10 PM Wednesday to 8 AM Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult across the Eastern Sierra. The hazardous conditions will impact the Thursday morning commute. Delays likely, road closures possible. Very strong winds could cause tree damage and even power outages. Periods of low visibility in blowing snow possible.
info.instruction: Even light snowfall causes major travel delays, especially during periods of high traffic volume. Be sure to allow extra time to reach your destination. Leave extra space between vehicles since it takes longer to stop on slick roadways. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
